bio.title: Velvet Painting from Colombia
bio.location: Life of the painter Mar칤a Abt-Dutzi, Bad W칬rishofen
bio.techniqueDescription: Velvet painting using traditional Colombian pointillism technique
bio.legacyDescription: My work represents the fusion of two cultures, keeping traditional Colombian techniques alive while adapting them to the European context, creating an artistic bridge between continents.

paragraphs.p1: On July 29, 1952, I was born in Bogot치, the capital of Colombia, as the second daughter of academic painter Guillermo Malaver and his wife Margarita.
paragraphs.p2: When I was about 11 years old, my father discovered that I had inherited his talent. From that moment on, he regularly taught me oil and acrylic painting.
paragraphs.p3: In my training, he placed great emphasis on teaching me primarily our traditional Colombian painting technique, namely painting on velvet.
paragraphs.p4: The motifs of my figurative works are created in this painting technique solely through dots and not with brushstrokes, as the colors would otherwise mix.
paragraphs.p5: This South American painting style is practically unknown in Europe and differs in its effect on the viewer from the usual paintings that are painted exclusively on white canvas.
paragraphs.p6: As a gratitude to my father and mentor, I sign all my works to this day with the artistic name 'Malaver'.
paragraphs.p7: I first began studying psychopedagogy, but after one semester I realized that my true passion was painting.
paragraphs.p8: At the age of 26, I began working as an independent painter and during that time I held several exhibitions in my native country, including at:
paragraphs.p9: In 1992, I emigrated to Germany for love. Shortly after starting my new life in Germany, my first husband passed away from a serious illness.
paragraphs.p10: In 1994, I met my second husband, who encouraged me to resume my artistic activities.
